liveobject
Class LiveObject

java.lang.Object
  liveobject.LiveObject

public class LiveObject
extends java.lang.Object

Base class that implements a drawable object having a position, velocity, acceleration, orientation, and rotation in the universe.

Field Summary

          Acceleration of the object.

          The animator that manages our motion and redisplay.

Method Detail

canInteract

public boolean canInteract()
Method for determining whether another object can interact with this object. Subclasses may override this if there are certain situations in which they do not interact with other objects.

Returns:
true if this object can interact with other objects, and false otherwise.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
Method for drawing the object onto the display window. Subclasses will override this to draw themselves appropriately.

Parameters:
g - The graphics context to be used for drawing.

drawSegments

public void drawSegments(java.awt.Graphics g,
                         geometry.Segment2D[] segments)
Utility method for drawing a collection of segments. Most subclasses will use this to draw themselves.

Parameters:
g - Graphics context to use for drawing.
segments - Enumeration to generate the segments to draw.

overlaps

public boolean overlaps(LiveObject other)
Method for checking whether this object overlaps another object. That occurs when both objects have non-null extents, and the extent of this object overlaps the extent of the other object.

Parameters:
other - The object to be checked for overlap with this object.
Returns:
true if the argument object overlaps this object, and false otherwise.

Parameters:

public void update(double dt)
Method for performing one step of the physical simulation associated with this object. Subclasses may override to add additional calculations.

Parameters:
dt - The amount of time covered by the current time step.
